Name: Gabapentin (Neurontin)
Dosage: Take 2 capsules (each 300 MG) by mouth 3 times a day.
Usage: Treats nerve pain caused by shingles (postherpetic neuralgia).
Used with other medications to treat partial seizures in adults and children (epilepsy).

Common Side Effects: Swelling in hands or feet (peripheral edema)
Uncommon Side Effects: Allergic reactions (rash, hives, swelling of face/lips/tongue/throat)
Changes in mood or behavior (depression, anxiety, suicidal thoughts)
Difficulty breathing (especially if used with opioids)
